parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To spread, make a bed. Or simpler stronnuo, prolongation from a still simpler stroo, ; to 'strew, ' i.e. Spread.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
A bough, branch of a tree. From a primary steibo; a spread of loose materials for a couch, i.e. a bough of a tree so employed.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A primary verb; to 'chop'; specially, to beat the breast in grief.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.
